title: ART FOR OCEANS Youth Art Show
description: Are you a youth artist with a passion for ocean conservation? We are currently accepting submissions for ART FOR OCEANS, a youth art show that will be exhibited in June 2024 at Wild Geese Gallery in Upper West Side, Manhattan, NYC. This is a NOAA Ocean Guardian Youth Ambassador Community Event.

provider.name: NOAA Ocean Guardian Youth Ambassador Hayden Almeraz

requirements: Artist(s) must be aged 12 - 24
Art must speak to the issues of ocean conservation and/or climate activism
Submissions can be any medium of art

title: Marine Art Contest for Grades K-12
description: Students are invited to enter the free 2024 Marine Art Contest. The theme is 'Exploring The Biological Diversity of Stellwagen Bank National Marine Sanctuary.' The art can depict one or more representative species, show a predator-prey relationship, or illustrate diverse species in a sanctuary habitat.
requirements: Participants must be in grades K-12
Contest will be held online with virtual submissions
Prizes range from $50 cash rewards to certificates

title: YE4C Ripple Effect: Make Waves for Water Awareness Contest
description: Create an original piece of content (video, artwork, photography, or written) that highlights the importance of water in our communities or showcases potential careers in the field. No copyrighted or AI-generated submissions will be accepted. Three winners will be selected to receive $100 gift cards.
requirements: Participants must be aged 13 - 24
Content must be original and not copyrighted
Content must not be AI-generated
Content must highlight the importance of water or showcase potential careers in the field

title: Atlantic Marine Conservation Society Volunteering
description: AMCS' goal is to work in the communities of New York to better combat the issues challenging our environment. Volunteers can help in beach monitoring, fundraising/marketing, and volunteer program management. Volunteers may also work in Excel data analysis, grant writing, IT, etc.\n\nNote: Only volunteers aged 18+ can engage in hands-on contact with animals.
requirements: Volunteers must be aged 12+
Volunteers under 18 must be accompanied by an adult
Volunteers aged 18+ should be comfortable with hands-on contact with animals

title: National Weather Service Virtual School Talks
description: The National Weather Service (NWS) National School Outreach team is ready to teach and answer your students' weather questions. The NWS, through Google Meet, Zoom, or Skype, jumps into the classroom to help teach these topics to elementary through high school students.
requirements: Schools must have a Google Meet, Zoom, or Skype account
Sessions are available for elementary through high school students
Sessions are available for all ages

title: YOI World Ocean Day Zine
description: The Youth Oceanic Initiative (YOI) invites youth ages 13-21 to participate in their 2024 World Ocean Day Zine! Submit artwork(s) related to the ocean to be showcased live on their World Ocean Day webinar for a chance to win $20!
requirements: Participants must be aged 13 - 21
Artwork must be related to the ocean
Artwork will be showcased live on the World Ocean Day webinar

title: Bowseat 2024 Ocean Awareness Contest
description: The 2024 Ocean Awareness Contest encourages you to become a climate witness and share your own unique climate story. Use this opportunity to learn about the climate crisis and how it impacts your family and community, and to examine your individual responses to our evolving world.
requirements: Participants must be aged 11 - 18
Artwork must be related to the climate crisis
Artwork will be showcased in the 2024 Ocean Awareness Contest

title: Young Changemakers Fellowship
description: Participating students will design and carry out an action project to address an ocean or environmental issue in their home community and share their perspectives with NOAA on important ocean and environmental issues.
requirements: Must be a high school student at least 13 years of age

title: Diverseas Volunteer
description: Are you passionate about the ocean and eager to make a difference in educating others about its importance? Look no further! Diverseas, an ocean literacy initiative, is seeking dedicated volunteers to join our team and help spread awareness about marine conservation and sustainability.
requirements: Volunteers must be passionate about marine conservation and sustainability
Volunteers must be willing to educate others about the importance of the ocean
Must be youth (under 24 years old)

title: True Blue Fellowship
description: The True Blue Fellowship provides mentorship, capacity building, and funding of up to $2,500 for 10 youth-led projects that address ocean, waterways, and/or climate change issues in their local communities through a creative arts lens.
requirements: Must be between the ages of 13 and 24
Must apply in exclusively English
Projects must address ocean, waterways, and/or climate change issues
Projects must be youth-led and creative

title: MPA Exploration
description: Virtual program for students to learn about MPAs. Though it's intended as a curriculum, it has great information to learn about the Crystal Cove State Marine Conservation Area as well as collecting/analyzing data.

provider.name: Crystal Cove State Marine Conservation Area

requirements: Program is intended for high school students
Program is available for all ages
In-Person programs are available in Newport Beach, CA

title: GuggTeen Sustainable Studio Series
description: Connect with others who are interested in artmaking and sustainability as you the future of climate impact in the studio and beyond. Participants will explore current exhibitions, experiment with environmentally friendly studio practices, and learn about sustainability at the museum.
requirements: Participants must be aged 13 - 19
Participants must be interested in artmaking and sustainability
Participants will explore current exhibitions and learn about sustainability at the museum

title: Ocean Busters Leadership Opportunities
description: Ocean Busters, an international youth organization focused on stopping climate change and other environmental issues is looking for new members and board members for their organization.
requirements: Must be aged 13 - 24
Must be interested in stopping climate change and other environmental issues
Must be interested in joining an international youth organization

title: Sounds of the Ocean
description: Sounds of the Ocean is calling all ocean enthusiasts for an opportunity to become an ambassador. Ambassadors will join an international group of artists, scientists, athletes and ocean advocates in bi-monthly sessions, exclusive gatherings, special access to their events, and more!
requirements: For all ocean enthusiasts

title: Behavioral Husbandry Aquatheater Intern
description: The New York Aquarium's Aquatheater internship program expands upon the aquarium's long-term efforts to educate future animal care professionals. During this internship, interns will assist in all aspects of care of California sea lions and Harbor seals and may have the opportunity to perform in daily animal presentations.
requirements: Must be 18 or older
Ability to memorize a script
Ability to perform physical tasks

title: N:OW for Net-Zero Funding
description: N:OW for Net-Zero is providing funding to Canadian students and educators who want to implement projects that reduce GHG emissions and/or improve net-zero literacy in their communities.
requirements: Must be a part of a Canadian school for 6-12 OR an Indigenous community project involving youth
Youth led by 2+ youth w/ support from at least one adult

title: GenSea
description: Join the global community of young ocean advocates to protect and restore our ocean planet. Members will have the chance to connect and collaborate with a community of ocean advocates, build ocean advocacy skills, share their conservation work, and take direct action to protect the ocean.
requirements: Youth must be of ages 13-25

title: PIMS Internships
description: Internships at the Perry Institute for Marine Science provide educational and practical support to students aiming to gain skills in a variety of areas supporting ocean conservation and stewardship. If you're interested in marine science and conservation, an internship with PIMS, may be a great idea for you!
requirements: At least 17 years old
Currently enrolled in college or recent college graduate
Minimum GPA of 2.5
Review other requirements on website

title: Monterey Bay Aquarium Internships
description: The Monterey Bay Aquarium offers various internships and externships through their program. Their internship program helps build a more diverse workforce by supporting the recruitment of qualified undergraduate and graduate students from underrepresented communities with meaningful work experience under a mentor.
requirements: At least 18 years old
Current/recent student at a college, university, tech, or trade school
Must be a student during the term immediately preceding internship

title: Youth Ocean Advocates
description: The Seattle Aquarium's Youth Ocean Advocates program is designed for young people passionate about ocean conservation. Advocates will learn about the marine environment, participate in citizen science projects, and develop communication and advocacy skills.
requirements: Enrolled in grades 9-12 at the time of application
